title: fennic
author: fennic
content: Hi guys I think I might have heart Attack cause when I buy Bitcoin it goes to lows and when I sell Bitcoin it goes higher and today I sold my all Bitcoin earnings that were 200 dollars and than. BITCOIN starting pumping very hard and that was very very annoying to me. What should I do about this?

comments.author: Anonylz
comments.body: Quote from: fennic on October 01, 2022, 06:20:23 PMHi guys I think I might have heart Attack cause when I buy Bitcoin it goes to lows and when I sell Bitcoin it goes higher and today I sold my all Bitcoin earnings that were 200 dollars and than. BITCOIN starting pumping very hard and that was very very annoying to me. What should I do about this?Hope you don't get a heart attack because of btc because while you are gone the market will keep moving ahead. If you want to have peace of mind in this market, learn to have a long-term goal, this way all these minor drops won't bother you too much, but if you keep looking at the market every second then you are definitely close to getting a heart attack.If you can't handle the pressure don't be in this space.

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Get professional help if price fluctuations in things like stocks and crypto are life-threatening to you and give you panic attacks. Seriously.

comments.author: Haunebu
comments.body: Heart attack? I really don't think this is the right market for you since it's an extremely volatile market where swings happen quite often honestly speaking. Recent BTC swings have actually been pretty small.You should always invest only what you are willing to lose. If you don't maintain this mindset, you will suffer a lot whenever things don't go your way in this market.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: fennic on October 01, 2022, 06:20:23 PMHi guys I think I might have heart Attack cause when I buy Bitcoin it goes to lows and when I sell Bitcoin it goes higher and today I sold my all Bitcoin earnings that were 200 dollars and than. BITCOIN starting pumping very hard and that was very very annoying to me. What should I do about this?Seems like you aren't a believer in Bitcoin and are just trying to get some easy money.  The free market has a way of making sure you lose everything trying to trade to profits with that mindset.  If you sold all your Bitcoin, then you stopped believing in it and shouldn't care what happens to the price.  If you think a tiny move that cost you a couple of dollars is enough to give you a heart attack, wait until the price goes up x20 and think about how you missed the boat because you were trying to trade to earn a few extra dollars.  You either believe in Bitcoin or you don't.  If you believe, invest and use or hold onto it.  If you don't believe, who cares?  Trading is for suckers though.

comments.author: Ultegra134
comments.body: You'll need to refrain from investing if you cannot bear the risk of failure. I don't know where you're from, but $200 is a small amount. I've been screwed off with way higher amounts, either by selling too early or by buying too high. As someone who has previously suffered (and still occasionally suffers) with anxiety and stress, I'd advise you to keep off trading if you don't have the stomach for it. Anxiety was the main reason I gave up trading and stuck to holding Bitcoin. I don't even care how much Bitcoin is worth; my main goal is to accumulate as much as possible.It wouldn't hurt if you were to seek help from a psychologist, as NotATether suggested. Money shouldn't revolve around our lives; it shouldn't stress us to the point of having a possible heart attack.

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: Quote from: fennic on October 01, 2022, 06:20:23 PMHi guys I think I might have heart Attack cause when I buy Bitcoin it goes to lows and when I sell Bitcoin it goes higher and today I sold my all Bitcoin earnings that were 200 dollars and than. BITCOIN starting pumping very hard and that was very very annoying to me. What should I do about this?Lolz, we all experience this same scenario, I personally have experience this so so many times, so it is not entirely something new.Advice I can give to you is stop looking for short term profit, looking for short term profit is the reason why you even notice that bitcoin goes down after you have bought, investing for long term will make you see the decline in price as an opportunity to buy more at a lower rate thereby bringing your average dollar cost down.So better learn to stop panic-buying and panic-selling and invest for the long term, hold and take your eyes away from the price actions, anytime you decide to look at the price, it should be you checking whether its time to buy more or keep holding what you already bought.
